marketNews.title: Indonesia Q4 2024 GDP Growth 5.02% YoY, 0.53% QoQ
marketNews.content: The Central Statistics Agency (BPS) reported that Indonesia's economy grew by 5.02% year-on-year in the fourth quarter of 2024 (versus 4Q24: +4.95% YoY), surpassing the consensus estimate of 4.98% YoY. On a quarterly basis, the economy expanded by 0.53% quarter-on-quarter in 4Q24 (versus 3Q24: +1.5% QoQ), slightly below the consensus of 0.56% QoQ. The 2024 annual growth rate therefore amounted to 5.03% YoY (2023: 5.05% YoY), below the government target of 5.2% YoY and marking the slowest growth in three years. The 2024 expansion was driven by household consumption (+4.94% YoY) and gross fixed capital formation (+4.61% YoY), contributing +2.6 and +1.43 percentage points respectively. Net exports contributed a negative 0.01 percentage point due to a rise in imports (+7.95% YoY) that outpaced export growth (+6.51% YoY). Government consumption added +0.48 percentage points (6.61% YoY), with the remaining +0.53 percentage points coming from other variables.

marketNews.title: U.S. President Donald Trump proposes U.S. takeover of Gaza
marketNews.content: U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday, February 4, 2025, proposed that the United States take over Gaza, without providing further details. The statement was delivered at a press conference together with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, who was on a visit. Earlier, Trump had also suggested that the Palestinian population be permanently relocated from Gaza.

marketNews.title: Indonesia postpones rice assistance distribution
marketNews.content: Indonesia's Coordinating Minister for Food Affairs, Zulkifli Hasan, said on Tuesday, February 4, 2025, that the government is postponing the distribution of the 10-kilogram monthly rice assistance, which had originally been scheduled for January-February 2025. He explained that the postponement aims to keep farm-gate rice prices stable, as the country is entering the main harvest season. He added that the food assistance will be distributed after the harvest season ends, without providing further details.

marketNews.title: U.S. job openings fall to 7.6 million in December 2024
marketNews.content: The U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics reported that job openings in the United States fell by 556,000 to 7.6 million in December 2024 (versus November 2024: 8.16 million), below the consensus estimate of 8 million and marking the lowest level in three months. The data indicates that the U.S. labor market is gradually weakening.

tickerNews.title: Bank Mandiri FY24 Net Profit +1.3% YoY, Credit +19.5% YoY
tickerNews.content:
Bank Mandiri (BMRI) recorded net profit of IDR 13.8 trillion in 4Q24 (-14% YoY, -11% QoQ). This resulted in a full-year 2024 net profit of IDR 55.8 trillion (+1.3% YoY), matching 99% of the FY24 consensus estimate. The performance was supported by: 1) Net Interest Margin (NIM) in line with guidance; 2) Cost of Credit (CoC) at an all-time low; 3) solid credit growth; and 4) rising operating expenses. NIM for the bank-only business improved to 4.95% in 4Q24 (vs. 4Q23: 4.96%, 3Q24: 4.86%). Consolidated NIM for FY24 was 5.15% (FY23: 5.48%), matching the FY24 guidance range of 5-5.3%. Loan yield rose due to repricing in several credit segments and is expected to stay high at least through H1-25. NIM is pressured by higher Cost of Funds, especially from higher Time Deposit rates. Management targets FY25 NIM of 5-5.2%, roughly in line with FY24 actual and guidance.

CoC fell to an all-time-low 0.79% in FY24 (FY23: 0.85%), better than the FY24 guidance of ≤1% and marking the lowest annual CoC in the company’s history. The result was supported by sound asset quality, with Gross Non-Performing Loans improving to 1.12% (4Q23: 1.19%, 3Q24: 1.13%) and Loan-at-Risk falling below pre-pandemic level to 6.76% (4Q23: 8.62%, 3Q24: 7.51%). Management targets a normalized CoC of 1-1.2% in FY25.

Credit growth was +19.5% YoY in 4Q24 (4Q23: +16.3% YoY, 3Q24: +20.8% YoY), beating the FY24 guidance of +16-18% YoY. Growth was driven by wholesale (+26% YoY), mainly corporate. Third-party funds (DPK) grew only +7.7% YoY, giving a consolidated loan-to-deposit ratio of 98% in 4Q24. BMRI aims to normalize LDR to 90-95% in FY25 and to moderate credit growth to +10-12% YoY.

Operating profit (PPOP) fell to IDR 21.1 trillion in 4Q24 (-6.8% YoY, -9.5% QoQ) as operating expenses surged (+23% YoY, +36% QoQ). General and administrative expenses rose sharply in 4Q24 (+41% YoY, +63% QoQ) and rose +17% YoY for the full year.

Key Takeaway: We assess BMRI’s performance as neutral. The NIM aligned with FY24 guidance is a positive aspect, given that NIM had been a concern in 9M24. Going forward, FY25 liquidity pressures could affect CoF and NIM, especially as the LDR remains high. Management plans to keep the dividend payout ratio at ≥60% for FY24 (2023: 60%), implying a dividend yield of roughly 6.5% based on the Wednesday (5/2) price of IDR 5,525 per share.

*This article was previously released on Wednesday (5/2) afternoon in Stockbit Commentary.*

tickerNews.title: Prajogo Pangestu purchases 30.9 million BRPT shares
tickerNews.content: Prajogo Pangestu, controlling shareholder and President Commissioner of Barito Pacific, bought 30.9 million shares of PT Barito Pacific Tbk (BRPT) at an average price of IDR 923.77 per share on 30 January 2025. The transaction value was approximately IDR 28.5 billion. After the transaction, Prajogo Pangestu’s ownership in BRPT increased from 71.31% to 71.35%.

tickerNews.title: XL Axiata posts strong 4Q24 profit and stable ARPU
tickerNews.content: XL Axiata reported net profit of IDR 502 billion in 4Q24 (+95% YoY, +72% QoQ). The result lifted FY24 net profit to IDR 1.8 trillion (+45% YoY), matching 99% of the FY24 consensus estimate. Operating profit in 4Q24 was IDR 1.5 trillion (+33% YoY, +20% QoQ), taking FY24 operating profit to IDR 5.6 trillion (+28% YoY), slightly above the consensus of 103% of the FY24 forecast. Average revenue per user (ARPU) in the mobile segment was stable at IDR 41,000 (-5% YoY, 0% QoQ), while subscriber numbers rose to 58.8 million (+2% YoY, +0.3% QoQ).

tickerNews.title: Kalbe Farma FY24 profit beats consensus
tickerNews.content: Kalbe Farma reported an indicative net profit of IDR 861 billion in 4Q24 (+23% YoY, +50% QoQ). The FY24 indicative net profit reached IDR 3.24 trillion (+17.1% YoY), in line with 102% of the FY24 consensus estimate. The profit improvement was driven by (1) revenue growth of +7% YoY and +6% QoQ and (2) gross profit margin rising to 41.3% (4Q23: 37%, 3Q24: 38.6%). Kalbe Farma targets FY25 revenue and net profit growth of +8-10% YoY.

tickerNews.title: GoTo denies merger talks with Grab
tickerNews.content: GoTo Gojek Tokopedia clarified in a filing to the Indonesia Stock Exchange that there is no agreement with any party to execute a merger, contrary to media reports. GoTo also stated that no discussions have taken place with Grab Holdings Ltd. (Nasdaq: GRAB). The clarification followed a DealStreetAsia report that GoTo and Grab were accelerating merger talks and targeting a deal in 2025. Following the DealStreetAsia story, Bloomberg reported that Grab is considering acquiring GoTo for more than US$7 billion, with one scenario involving a purchase of all GoTo shares at more than IDR 100 per share.

tickerNews.title: BBNI announces up to IDR 905 billion share buyback
tickerNews.content: Bank Negara Indonesia announced a share buyback programme with a funding allocation of up to IDR 905 billion. The buyback, expected to be executed over a maximum of 12 months after approval at the 2025 Annual General Meeting on 13 March 2025, will be carried out at a price deemed fair by the company, in accordance with POJK No. 29/2023. Treasury shares acquired will be used for the employee and/or director and commissioner share-ownership program.

tickerNews.title: TPMA targets 15-20% performance growth in 2025 with US$14 million capex
tickerNews.content: Trans Power Marine’s director, Rudy Sutiono, said the company targets a performance growth of about +15-20% in 2025. TPMA has allocated US$14 million in capex for 2025 (versus US$20 million in 2024), intended for the addition of four tugboats and barges.

tickerNews.title: Indomobil Sukses Internasional launches Yadea electric-motor partnership and new energy subsidiary
tickerNews.content: Indomobil Sukses Internasional announced that it has completed a distribution partnership for Yadea electric motorcycles and related products. Yadea will directly manage its business in Indonesia. In a separate information disclosure, IMAS and its subsidiary PT IMG Sejahtera Langgeng established a new company, PT Indo Zeeda Energi, with a paid-in capital of IDR 5 billion. The new entity will conduct activities supporting electricity, motor-vehicle parts and accessories, and its own or leased real-estate.

tickerNews.title: SOCI director Go Darmadi sells 120 million shares
tickerNews.content: Société Générale Indonesia (SOCI) director Go Darmadi sold 120 million SOCI shares at an average price of IDR 160 per share on 24 January 2025. The transaction value was IDR 19.2 billion. After the transaction, Go Darmadi’s ownership fell from 1.7% to zero.

tickerNews.title: TRUK director Budi Gunawan purchases 5 million shares
tickerNews.content: Pengendali sekaligus Direktur Utama Guna Timur Raya (TRUK) bought 5 million TRUK shares at an average price of IDR 103 per share on 3 February 2025. The transaction value was IDR 515 million. After the transaction, Budi Gunawan’s ownership increased from 1.23% to 2.38%.

tickerNews.title: MINA shareholder Hapsoro sells 46.8 million shares
tickerNews.content: Pengendali Sanurhasta Mitra (MINA) sold 46.8 million MINA shares at an average price of IDR 82 per share between 24 January and 4 February 2025. The transaction value was about IDR 3.8 billion. After the transaction, Hapsoro’s direct ownership fell from 5.73% to approximately 5.02%.

tickerNews.title: PZZA shareholder buys 11 million shares
tickerNews.content: Pemberton Asian Opportunities Fund, a shareholder of Sarimelati Kencana (PZZA), bought approximately 11 million PZZA shares at an average price of about IDR 159.9 per share on 4 February 2025. The transaction value was about IDR 1.8 billion. After the transaction, the fund’s ownership rose from 8.97% to 9.34%.
